content: Hello! Thanks for contacting XYZ Home Services. How can I help you today?
Yeah, I’ve got a leaking pipe, but I’m not sure it’s worth your company’s time. What do you even charge?
I'd be happy to help with your leaking pipe! Could you tell me a bit more about the issue? Also, I can provide a price estimate—just a few questions first. May I have your name, please?
Well, my name’s Steve, and the pipe is under my kitchen sink. I don’t want to pay an arm and a leg for something a monkey could fix, you know?
Thanks, Steve! We aim for fair prices and quality work. May I get your address to see if you’re in our service area? I’ll then estimate the cost for you.
It’s 1245 Maple Lane. But seriously, just give me a ballpark. I can’t stand being upsold for nonsense.

You're in our service area, Steve! For a leaking pipe under the kitchen sink, the typical estimate starts around $100, depending on the extent of the issue. There are no hidden fees, and we’ll provide a full explanation before any work is done. Does that sound reasonable?
$100 for a pipe?? That seems ridiculous! What if it’s just a loose nut or something? I don’t see why I’d pay that. No offense, but do you even guarantee your work?

No offense taken! We do guarantee all our work. The price covers service, inspection, and minor repairs. If it’s just a quick fix, that’s all you'll pay. We’re all about transparency. Would you like to schedule a technician to take a look?

Let me think about it. I just don’t want to waste time with someone who’s gonna show up late or charge me more once they’re here. And I hate waiting all day for a window. What’s your earliest option for someone to come, IF I decide to try you guys?

We understand your concerns, Steve. Our techs arrive within tight time frames, and we’ll always keep you informed. If you share your ideal day and time, I can check our earliest available slot for you.

I don’t know, maybe tomorrow if you’re not gonna leave me hanging all day. But again, if it’s just some minor thing, I’m not paying through the nose. I’ve had techs charge silly fees for 5 minutes of work before. What else do I have to tell you before I actually get someone scheduled?

Thank you! To book your appointment, I just need to check our calendar for tomorrow and confirm a time slot. Would you prefer morning or afternoon? After that, your booking is all set and I’ll send you all the details to review.
Honestly, I might just do it myself if I can figure it out. I’ve had enough of home service companies ghosting me or pressuring me for upgrades. Maybe I’ll call back if it gets worse.
reason: Customer did not proceed with booking despite agent offers and information.
